declarations.comments:
Attempt to read a variant at a given label by providing branches.
The failure branch receives the provided variant, but with the label
removed.
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments:
Inject into the variant at a given label.
```purescript
maybeAtFoo :: forall r. VariantF (foo :: FProxy Maybe | r) Int
maybeAtFoo = inj (SProxy :: SProxy "foo") (Just 42)
```
declarations.title: inj

declarations.comments:
Combinator for partial matching with a default value in case of failure.
```purescript
caseFn :: forall r. VariantF (foo :: FProxy Maybe, bar :: FProxy (Tuple String) | r) Int -> String
caseFn = default "No match"
 # on (SProxy :: SProxy "foo") (\foo -> "Foo: " <> maybe "nothing" show foo)
 # on (SProxy :: SProxy "bar") (\bar -> "Bar: " <> show (snd bar))
```
declarations.title: default

declarations.comments:
Combinator for exhaustive pattern matching.
```purescript
caseFn :: VariantF (foo :: FProxy Maybe, bar :: FProxy (Tuple String), baz :: FProxy (Either String)) Int -> String
caseFn = case_
 # on (SProxy :: SProxy "foo") (\foo -> "Foo: " <> maybe "nothing" show foo)
 # on (SProxy :: SProxy "bar") (\bar -> "Bar: " <> show (snd bar))
 # on (SProxy :: SProxy "baz") (\baz -> "Baz: " <> either id show baz)
```
declarations.title: case_

declarations.comments: A value-level proxy for a type-level symbol.
declarations.title: SProxy

declarations.comments:
An extensible effect Monad, indexed by a set of effect functors. Effects
are eliminated by interpretation into a pure value or into some base
effect Monad. The `Run` Monad is an alternative to Monad Transformers,
and can represent both associative and non-associative effects.

An example using `State` and `Except`:
```purescript
type MyEffects =
  ( state ∷ STATE Int
  , except ∷ EXCEPT String
  , base ∷ BaseEff (console ∷ CONSOLE)
  )

yesProgram ∷ Run MyEffects Unit
yesProgram = do
  whenM (gets (_ < 0)) do
    throw "Number is less than 0"
  whileM_ (gets (_ > 0)) do
    liftEff $ log "Yes"
    modify (_ - 1)

main =
  yesProgram
    # catch (liftEff <<< log)
    # runState 10
    # runBase
    # void
````
declarations.title: Run

declarations.comments:
Lifts an effect functor into the `Run` Monad according to the provided
`SProxy` slot.
declarations.title: liftEffect

declarations.comments: Lifts a base effect into the `Run` Monad (eg. `Eff`, `Aff`, or `IO`).
declarations.title: liftBase

declarations.comments:
Reflects the next instruction or the final value if there are no more
instructions.
declarations.title: peel

declarations.comments: Enqueues an instruction in the `Run` Monad.
declarations.title: send

declarations.comments: Extracts the value from a fully interpreted program.
declarations.title: run

declarations.comments: Extracts the value from a program with only base effects.
declarations.title: runBase

declarations.comments: Interprets an effect functor into the base effect, eliminating the label.
declarations.title: interpret

modules.name: Run.Streaming
modules.comments:
This module defines primitives for bidirectional streams analagous to
the Haskell `Pipes` library. Namely, streams may be either pull or pull
and can propagate information both upstream and downstream.

declarations.comments: Yields a response and waits for a request.
declarations.title: respond

declarations.comments: Issues a request and awaits a response.
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments: Yields a value to be consumed downstream.
declarations.title: yield

declarations.comments: Awaits a value upstream.
declarations.title: await

declarations.comments: Producers yield values of type `o` using effects `r`.
declarations.title: Producer

declarations.comments: Consumers await values of type `i` using effects `r`.
declarations.title: Consumer

declarations.comments: Transformers await values `i` and yield values `o` using effects `r`.
declarations.title: Transformer

declarations.comments: Servers reply to requests `req` with responses `res` using effects `r`.
declarations.title: Server

declarations.comments: Clients issue requests `req` and await responses `res` using effects `r`.
declarations.title: Client

declarations.comments: A full bidirectional Pipe acts as an upstream Client and a downstream Server.
declarations.title: Pipe

declarations.comments: Pairs inputs and outputs with a left bias.
declarations.title: fuse

declarations.comments:
Subsitutes the outputs of the second argument with the continuation of the
first argument, and vice versa, interleaving the two.
declarations.title: interleave

declarations.comments:
Substitutes the outputs of the second argument with the effects of the
first argument, feeding the result back in to the stream.
declarations.title: substitute

modules.name: Run.Streaming.Pull
modules.comments: This modules defines primitive fusion operations for pull streams.

declarations.comments:
Connects a Client to a Server (or less generally, a Consumer to a Producer),
where the Client pulls information from the Server.
declarations.title: fuse

declarations.comments:
Connects a Client to a dynamic Server which depends on the request
of the client. Practically, this means one can write a stateful Server
jump started by an initial request from the Client.
declarations.title: chain

declarations.comments: Fulfills a Client/Consumer with effects.
declarations.title: for

modules.name: Run.Streaming.Push
modules.comments: This modules defines primitive fusion operations for push streams.

declarations.comments:
Connects a Server to a Client (or less generally, a Producer to a Consumer),
where the Server pushes information to the Client.
declarations.title: fuse

declarations.comments:
Connects a Server to a dynamic Client which depends on the output
of the Server. Practically, this means one can write a stateful Client
jump started by an initial event from the Server.
declarations.title: chain

declarations.comments: Loops over a Server/Producer with effects.
declarations.title: for
